org.jlokalize
Class KeysTableModel

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      org.jlokalize.KeysTableModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel
public class KeysTableModel
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel

Model for the data of the keys table. Main purpose is to control the content of the keys table, but also prepare the content for the renderer and create internal lists of keys given a currently selected node in the language tree, as well as updating the keys list. More or less the heart of what you can do with the program within one language structure. The keys shown in the table are the union of the keys given by the current node and the parent/master node including deleted keys (this is handled by the language structure itself). However the status depends on the existence in either of these language structures and on the modified flag. Not only a key is stored but also a text, comment pair. They are always sorted alphabetically. To ensure that this is done right is quite a tough task.

See Also:

getValueAt

public java.lang.Object getValueAt(int rowIndex,
                                   int columnIndex)
Returns the value at a specific row and column. Is used for rendering. So we create a new KeysTableEntry object containing all necessary information, eg. key, modified, here/not here.

Parameters:
rowIndex - The row.
columnIndex - The column.
Returns:
A KeysTableEntry object.

update

public void update(org.tools.common.TreeNode<LanguageProperties> node)
If a new node is selected in the language tree, update the keys table completely. Node is used to obtain the master/parent node, the joint keys list and rebuild the whole thing.

Parameters:
node - A TreeNode.

clear

public void clear()
Just clears the whole table. Just when closing a project.

getEntry

public KeyEntry getEntry(int rowIndex)
Returns an entry from the table for use outside. There a new KeyEntry object is created with all necessary information (keys, texts, comments). Also the activeRow is set.

Parameters:
rowIndex - The row.
Returns:
A KeyEntry object.

getRow

public int getRow(java.lang.String key)
Sometimes we need to keep track of newly created keys or such.

Parameters:
key - The key to search for.
Returns:
The current index in the key list or -1 if not in list.

containsKey

public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
This is used to prevent inserting of keys that are already in the main data structure. However keys from the parent are not regarded.

Parameters:
key - The key.
Returns:
True if contained in the main data structure.

updateLastKey

public void updateLastKey(java.lang.String text,
                          java.lang.String comment)
Updates the currently active key with new text and comment.

Parameters:
text - The new text.
comment - The new comment.

getNextNotHereKey

public int getNextNotHereKey(int row)
Used for faster moving in the table. Jumps to the next key that has status OnlyInParent.

Parameters:
row - Actual row.
Returns:
Next row or -1 if none is existing.

insertKey

public boolean insertKey(java.lang.String key)
Insert a new key in main data structure.

Parameters:
key - The new key.
Returns:
False if key was already present, otherwise true.

removeKey

public boolean removeKey()
Removes the key of the active row.

Returns:
True, if the key was a member of the main data structure (we cannot remove keys from a parent).

renameKey

public int renameKey(java.lang.String newKey)
Rename the key of the active row to a new name. This can prolong the table since the old key can still be contained in the parent. In another way it can shorten the table, if the new key is also present in the parent, but the old key wasn't. Comment: Be aware that the function on LanguageProperties like renameKey, ... handle the issue of comment within themselves. So no need to worry about here.

Parameters:
newKey - The new key.
Returns:
New active row.

restore

public void restore()
Restores the content of the active row to the status it had upon loading of the structure. The whole logic is inside of LaguageProperties. However a rebuild is necessary.
